page.title: 03THE MARKET,MANSFIELD
page.content: {MANSFIELD}WAS FIRST GRANTED A MARKET CHARTER IN 1227 AND TODAY IT STANDS THRIVING AND BUSTLING IN THE CENTRE OF THE TOWN.IT IS HELD IN THE OPEN AIR MARKET PLACE EVERY MONDAY,THURSDAY, FRIDAY AND SATURDAY.OVER TWO HUNDRED WOODEN STALLS WITH CANVAS AWNINGS ARE ERECTED READY FOR THE MARKET.ON JULY 11th.1985 THERE WERE 119 DIFFERENT VENDORS SELLING A WIDE VARIETY OF ITEMS INCLUDING FRUIT,VEGETABLES, CLOTHING,JEWELLERY,HOUSEHOLD GOODS, CARDS AND TOYS. FRESH FISH AND MEAT ARE SOLD IN THE INDOOR FOOD HALL SITUATED JUST OFF THE MARKET PLACE.SOME STALLS SELL ITEMS SUCH AS HOT DOGS,HOT PEAS AND SHELL FISH,FOR SHOPPERS TO EAT AS THEY WALK AROUND.AT THE EDGE OF THE MARKET IS A HAND-TURNED ROUNDABOUT FOR YOUNG CHILDREN.IT IS A TYPICAL TOWN MARKET, USED FREQUENTLY BY LOCAL PEOPLE.
